rComments: Geeky funny, the closer she becomes to being a fossil the more she likes them. Can be supportive and will also just walk away mid-conversation if she's bored, doesn't wait for people, will reward you for good work but also be really harsh, even mean. I still have no idea if she likes or hates me. GOT TO OFFICE HOURS, trips are mandatory of course!

Hilde is an amazing professor. You can tell she really cares about the subject and she presents it in such good humor. I looked forward to learning more about dinosaurs, because Hilde made it really fun and easy. The class is one midterm, some lab assignments, and a final exam.

Hilde is hard core, but she's that way for a reason. Summer field may kick your ass, but if you can do well, it's well worth it to have Hilde in your corner. Try not to give her attitude. She forgets NOTHING!! Don't procrastinate in her classes, it will be your downfall.
She's an awesome person, funny sense of humor. but this class is devastatingly hard, especially for it being a GE course. Her finals will ruin you!
I absolutely loved this woman, she had a quirky sense of humor and she managed to make every class really interesting. I now appreciate dinosaurs a lot more than I used to. Ankylosaurs are the best.

Hilde is a hero. Her 109 class is challenging, but do able and is the ultimate preporation for summer field aka 188A. 188A is raw, in the field by 7 am, quiet by 10 pm, but the class changes lives. If you did 109 the work load of 188 is about 4 or 5 times as much, but all you do is geo for 4.5 wks so... Take Hilde's classes, and go to the rvr n 188

Hilde's a sweet lady with a lot of knowledge. My only complaints would be that the text was completely useless unless youre already a paleontologist and that she sometimes was difficult to hear and understand. She would say one thing then contradict it the next day but that didn't happen often.  I would consider taking another class with her.
Hilde is a wonderful teacher.  She is very enthusiastic about her subject and presents it, for the most part, in an interesting way.

Hilde is an AWESOME teacher. Her lectures are engaging, funny and packed with information. The class is hard but I would definitely recommend taking it - only take it P/F if you can. The material is awesome and her lectures are always full - not because attendance is required but because everyone WANTS to be there every day. TAKE THIS CLASS.

Very willing to work with students. Very hard class but she is amazing. She is very helpful and knows how to make students want to learn. She loves her work and enjoys teaching. She is excited about what she does and if you are excited about it you will learn a lot. The class is very hard but her work is not unreasonable. Huge time commitment.

Hilde was the best teacher I've had at UCSC.  She explains things very well and is extremely enthusiastic about the subject.  The New Idria project was both the most difficult, but most fun assignment I've had in college.  Take 109 with Hilde!!
Funny teacher. Entertaining and interesting lectures. A lot more about fossil discovery and a lot of memorization. Hard tests. Really detailed. Not an easy GE.

Best teacher i've experienced at UCSC.  She's funny, awesome music tastes, and very intelligent.  She expects the most, but easily facilitates her expectations with interesting lectures as well as trippy demos.  Highly recommended if you like dinos.  Tests are all off of her lectures. I never read the book and got an A

she puts all the notes and slides online so that helps, very informative, knows her stuff. she's quirky and demonstrates a lot about dinosaurs using interesting objects. if you love dinos, then this is it for you. she has extra credit opportunities, prizes, and cheat sheets

She is great...quirky and has a great sense of humor...her lectures are fun, interesting, and filled with amazing slides and movie clips...If you loved dinosaurs as a kid you will love this class...TA was bad, but grading is very fair...I felt like I was in a middle school science class when it came to the projects, but it was so much fun! Tests ok
"Basically, the stegosaurus' thigh muscles were hella big." -Hilde

This class is totally fun, especially if you are interested in Earth sciences, I found that some of my knowledge in other science courses were really helpful, although I wouldn't say necessary...Great class, totally interesting lectures. I really want to take more classes with this prof!

109 can be time consuming (weekend field trips, labs, reports, etc)and Hilde can make you work, but in the end it's so worth it. She's very approachable and has a poised teaching style. If you want to take this class,get in shape (you WILL bust your ass, especially @ Idria) and don't overload yourself with classes. Got an A but it didn't come cheap

Very interesting course with a helpful, intelligent and engaging professor. Very difficult and time consuming for a GE. The tests are extremely difficult with tons of memorization and there's a plethora of other work.  Make sure you study for the tests.  If you really want to learn everything about dinos, take this course.  Otherwise, steer clear

Hilde's really hard, and her field class can be really, really challenging.  But you know what, after taking Summer Field and comparing my field abilities with those who took it with Ken Cameron, I am EXTREMELY glad I took it with Hilde.  Take Hidle's field class, spent your time in the trenches, and you will benefit a lot!  Totally recommended.

I really liked Hilde.  Her field trips were great, class examples compelling (bowling balls swinging over the head to demonstrate an Anklyo's tail.  Why Not?).  If you were into dinos as a kid this also is a good nostalgia class.  Highly recommended.
Hilde made learning about dinosaurs more fun than watching Jurrasic Park. And yes, we did get to watch Jurrasic park.
She is difficult because she wants you to learn! She does a GREAT job at introducing you to the field. Plus the New Idria trip is SUPER fun =)
Hilde, will you marry me?

this class was awesome, so much fun! she's a cool professor. the sections were pretty lame, and she could've mixed up the lectures a little since it became repetitive after the 1st week, but otherwise, where else can you touch fossil and get a stable education about dinos?

Hilde is amazing.  The section quizes are really lame and the class is a little harder than i expected, but she is excellent.  Her lectures are very well prepared and she shows really cool dinosaur movies.  She knows her stuff and shes fun.  She makes you not hate going to class

BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD. EVER. she knows everything she is going to say when she steps in the door. she grades on many things. she is lively and fun and you pay attention and learn without meaning to. even if you hated the subject you could stay interested watching her fabulous teaching methods. if i ever teach i wana be half as good as her.

Hilde is fantastic and the class is awesome.  This is a great way to fulfill a GE if needed but also an interesting class.  The work load is pretty light and the tests are straightforward.  All and all, the class is extremely fair and very organized.  The assigned reading is light, and the textbook is really good compared to others i've had to read

This is not as easy as it seems. Section quizzes are arbituary and just tests to see if you remember an insignificant species name or whatever. The tests are stupid and tests your ability to memorize random dinosaur facts. Also there are projects, so stay away if you are taking it for an easy gen ed

Hilde is awesome.  She genuinely wants students to learn the material and flourish.  Initially, I thought she was cold towards students but as the quarter went on I found her to be truly nice and helpful.  She WILL prepare you well for future geology courses.
Hilde is awesome. a great teacher. she teaches with humor and clarity. and is pretty good looking for a older dino-nerd.

Hilde was one of the best teachers I have ever had.She was very clear during lectures, and made it easy to take notes and understand the material, which was sometimes difficult to grasp.Her quizzes and exams were very difficult, which challenged me.

Very qualified paleontologist/geologist/humorous science nerd, but class was difficult for those who weren't skilled at remembering and regurgitating banal scientific information. The weekly sections were also arduous and wasteful.
